content: this legal text summarizes the progress of a divorce case between mr h x and mrs v they appeared before a notary in 2021 to declare their mutual consent for divorce they discussed various aspects of their marriage children and assets including a jointly owned property they agreed that mr h x would transfer his share of the property to mrs v upon finalization of the divorce the text also mentions administrative provisions regarding the propertys soil quality and the requirement for a technical report for earthmoving activities the parties declare their awareness of the soil certificate and its execution deed the notary highlights the importance of the soil certificate guaranteeing soil purity and the rules outlined in chapter x regarding earthmoving activities the text further discusses the partners knowledge of the property including its landscape atlas archaeological zones architectural heritage woody plantations heritage value and historic gardens parks it mentions that the property is not located in a floodprone area but is in a flood risk zone determined by the federal government the partners choose to file a joint petition for divorce in the family court with the procedure conducted in dutch the costs and fees related to the agreement and property transfer will be shared equally the estimated value of the property is €104600000 with a taxable base of €26150000 the parties request a reduced rate of one percent for the transaction a general fixed fee is due until the condition of the divorce decree becoming final is fulfilled the general administration patrimonial documentation will not officially register or transcribe the deed the notary confirms the identity and marital status of the partners and they indicate their place of residence the cost for the right of writings is €750 the notary informs the parties about potential conflicts of interest and offers legal counsel the parties have read and signed the deed
